page.title: 11Farming in Fulford
page.content: Mr Bramley employs three men,a dairy man and two labourers. At busy times,like potato harvest,he employs further,casual,labour.Like most modern farmers the Bramleys use a great deal of machinery to lighten the work load.At present there are five tractors, two with front loaders,four high sided tipper trailers,one round baler,one square baler,two forage harvesters,a buck rake,a corn drier,a corn drill,a power harrow,a sprayer and a potato harvester.There is a muck spreader, a four furrow reversible plough,a chisel harrow and a combine harvester.Finally there is a battered Peugeot motor car for driving around the farm.Any broken tools can be mended in the farm's own workshop which has a range of tools,including welding equipment.More serious breakdowns are dealt with locally.
